title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 January 2009 - XWiki
content:
xwikibot - (02/01/2009 15:23): XWiki.JohnLeal was modified by XWiki.JohnLeal (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/JohnLeal

asyd - (02/01/2009 23:05): \\_o<  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:05): vmassol: ping?  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:08): asyd: pong  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:16): I want to instance a groovy class from another groovy class, the one I used for the notifier. However it's seem not really easy, since I don't have direct acces to xwiki object  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:30): asyd: I don't understand. Why don't you do a new? instance = new MyClass()  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:30): re xwiki objects you can pass them to the groovy class  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:31): ah oups, i miss http://pastebin.com/m391dc544  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:31): hmm all groovy class (store in xwiki) are in the classloader?  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:33): not sure what you're asking  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:33): I have the page Blah.ss  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:34): I have the page Blah.sshHelper, which defined the SshHelper class, and I want to create a new instance from the groovyclass which implements XWikiActionNotificationInterface  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:36): asyd: what about using parseGroovyFromPage()?  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:37): well, I try :) http://pastebin.com/m391dc544 sounds ok for you?  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:38): groovy.lang.MissingMethodException: No signature of method com.xpn.xwiki.XWiki.parseGroovyFromPage() is applicable for argument types: (java.lang.String) values: {"Users.SshHelper"}  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:39): that's true  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:39): ah  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:39): I thought getXWiki returns com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:40): that method exists in com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:40): it also exists in com.xpn.xwiki.XWiki but with an extra param  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:40): (the context)  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:40): ah?  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:40): oh  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:40): you don't need the new Context  stuff btw  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:41): you can use: xwikicontext.getWiki().parseGroovyFromPage("...", xwikicontext)  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:41): ok, thanks  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:41): the javaapi in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/DevGuide/API/xwiki-core-1.7-javadoc.zip/index.html only describe .api.\* objects  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:41): you can also pass $xwiki directly to the method  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:43):  you can get full javadoc here: http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/com/xpn/xwiki/platform/xwiki-core/1.7/  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:43): hmm   
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:43): groovy.lang.MissingMethodException: No signature of method com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiCo  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:43): ntext.getXWiki() is applicable for argument types: () values: {}  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:43): ok  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:43): sure  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:43): it doesn't exist  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:43): check what I typed :)  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:43): well, you told me xwikicontext.getWiki().parseGroovyFromPage("...", xwikicontext) :)  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:43): nope  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:43): I didn't say that  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:44): well yes I did  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:44): but it getWiki()  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:44): not getXWiki()  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:44): :)  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:44): oups, my bad )  
vmassol - (02/01/2009 23:45): note that with the latest xeclipse from trunk you get autocomplete on apis :)  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:46): that works, thanks  
asyd - (02/01/2009 23:47): ok, I'll try the trunk
